alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth; Ocean; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued March 28 at 1:58PM EDT until March 28 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL OCEAN...MERCER...SOUTHWESTERN SOMERSET...CENTRAL MONMOUTH AND SOUTHERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 157 PM EDT, a dangerous snow squall was located over Clearbrook Park, or 13 miles south of New Brunswick, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8A and 9. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 6 and 24. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 65 and 73. Locations impacted include... Old Bridge, East Brunswick, South Brunswick, Marlboro, Manalapan, Ewing, Holmdel, Princeton, Jamesburg, Hightstown, Cranbury, Pennington, Hopewell, Allentown, Roosevelt, Rocky Hill, Skillman, East Freehold, Six Flags Theme Park and West Freehold. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for sudden loss of traction.
